{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3023955,"name":"Noah","username":"noahbuttner","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/ed655f/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-03-16T02:10:10.169Z","cooked":"

Is there a good way to secure NEO Encoder cables into the Spark Max? Our NEO/encoder cable works fine when it is plugged in, but has come loose several times during testing. Any suggestions? Zipties/Electrical tape aren‚Äôt too much help in our specific situation.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2022-03-16T02:10:10.169Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":93,"reads":117,"readers_count":116,"score":488.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":405843,"topic_slug":"securing-neo-encoder-cable-to-spark-max","display_username":"Noah","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48730,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/securing-neo-encoder-cable-to-spark-max/405843/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3023958,"name":"risho900","username":"risho900","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/a698b9/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-03-16T02:14:57.926Z","cooked":"

I would ensure there‚Äôs proper strain relief on the cable. My team hasn‚Äôt had any issues with encoder cables coming lose

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2022-03-16T02:14:57.926Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":116,"readers_count":115,"score":28.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":405843,"topic_slug":"securing-neo-encoder-cable-to-spark-max","display_username":"risho900","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":32742,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/securing-neo-encoder-cable-to-spark-max/405843/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3023962,"name":"Chris Herzog","username":"zog","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/zog/{size}/266762_2.png","created_at":"2022-03-16T02:24:05.737Z","cooked":"

I‚Äôve got to agree with @risho900 - if there is no tension on the cable and it‚Äôs reasonably strain relieved, the friction on a 6 pin JST connector should be plenty to keep it in place. My teams have never had a problem there.

Do you have any pics of your situation? Are you sure there‚Äôs no tension on it at any point of you‚Äôre mechanism travel?

Maybe you have a damaged end. You can get replacements on Amazon (in kits) and if the wire itself isn‚Äôt damaged you can transfer the wires to a new housing pretty easily.

[ FRC 2151 + 3061 | Ri3D Redux '23 | RIP 4292 & 4241 ]","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3023969,"name":"Noah","username":"noahbuttner","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/ed655f/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-03-16T02:41:00.633Z","cooked":"

There is some tension, ideally our wire would be slightly longer. I assume extension cables exist? If so, could someone direct me to the best/fastest source to get them from?

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2022-03-16T02:41:00.633Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":101,"readers_count":100,"score":30.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":405843,"topic_slug":"securing-neo-encoder-cable-to-spark-max","display_username":"Noah","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48730,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/securing-neo-encoder-cable-to-spark-max/405843/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3023977,"name":"Mykah","username":"ExploitSage","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/exploitsage/{size}/179189_2.png","created_at":"2022-03-16T02:55:28.366Z","cooked":"

REV sells extension cables + joiner boards:

REV Robotics

JST PH 6-pin Extension Cable - 4 Pack

REV Robotics designs, builds and manufactures robotics parts and components used by students for learning about science, technology, engineering, and math (STEM). Our parts are commonly used within the FIRST Robotics Competition and the FIRST Tech...

REV Robotics

JST PH 6-pin Joiner Board - 4 Pack

REV Robotics designs, builds and manufactures robotics parts and components used by students for learning about science, technology, engineering, and math (STEM). Our parts are commonly used within the FIRST Robotics Competition and the FIRST Tech...

You can find plenty of JST PH 6-pin stuff on Amazon as well. Just be aware most JST PH Cables are female connectors at both ends, like the one that REV offers, so you‚Äôll need to get some kind of adapter/joiner board or find some with male connectors on one end.
